name: K2-155
scenarioDescription:
The K2-155 Exoplanetary System

K2-155 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.58 times its radius. It is located 267.45 light years away from the solar system.

K2-155 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-155 b

K2-155 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.34 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-155.

The mass of K2-155 b is 3.97 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-155 b is 1.8 that of Earth. At 3.97 Earth masses, K2-155 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-155 c

K2-155 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-155.

The mass of K2-155 c is 9.54 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-155 c is 2.6 that of Earth. At 9.54 Earth masses, K2-155 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-155 d

K2-155 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 40.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-155.

The mass of K2-155 d is 4.52 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-155 d is 1.9 that of Earth. At 4.52 Earth masses, K2-155 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-155, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
